byline.contributor: Rick Rojas reported from Phoenix, and Erik Eckholm from New York.
byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and ERIK ECKHOLM

abstract: Arizona State Senate passes bill requiring state agencies to keep confidential for 60 days identities of law enforcement officers involved in deadly or serious shootings; Gov Doug Ducey must decide whether to sign or veto bill.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Doug Ducey has until Monday to decide on whether to sign or veto a measure that would require confidentiality on officers’ names for 60 days.

headline.main: Arizona Bill Would Delay Disclosure of Names of Officers in Shootings
headline.print_headline: Arizona Bill Would Delay Disclosure of Names of Officers in Shootings

snippet: Gov. Doug Ducey has until Monday to decide on whether to sign or veto a measure that would require confidentiality on officers’ names for 60 days.
